data.name: Has he mutated?
data.description:
Mate's DNA consists of four letters: "M", "A", "T", "E". While he was out on an adventure, a meteor fell on him and his DNA changed. He hasn't mutated if at least half of the letters stayed the same (If it was "MAAA" and it became "MTTA" then the first and the fourth letters are the same) and there are NO foreign letters in his DNA (Everything except "M", "A", "T", "E", for exmaple "B", is a foreign letter). Write a function that takes two strings: DNA before and after the meteor fell on him and returns "YES" if Mate mutated, and "NO" otherwise. Lengths of both strings are the same.

Constraints:

1 ≤ length(DNA) ≤ 3000

Examples:

```python hasmutated("MATTATEA", "MTATAEEE") -> "NO" # Letters 1,4,5,7 are the same, DNA has 8 letters. hasmutated("MATE", "MTEA") -> "YES" # only first letters are the same. DNA has 4 letters. hasmutated("MATEEEE", "BATEEEE") -> "YES" # B is a foreign letter. ```
